etymologies: mid 19th century (originally in crinoline (sense 2), early crinolines being made of such material): from French, formed irregularly from Latin crinis ‘hair’ + linum ‘thread’

definitions: a stiffened or hooped petticoat worn to make a long skirt stand out.
shortDefinitions: stiffened or hooped petticoat worn to make long skirt stand out

definitions: a stiff fabric made of horsehair and cotton or linen thread, used for stiffening petticoats or as a lining.
shortDefinitions: stiff fabric made of horsehair and cotton or linen thread, used for stiffening petticoats or as lining
